div.bibl: Guide Book to the Exhibit of Russian Section America's Making, New York, 1921, p. 26. [RUSSIAN PEOPLES UNIVERSITY]

body.p: "Soon after the establishment of the Russian Collegiate Institute in New York a similar school was established in Chicago. It was headed by Prof. I. K. Novakovski and had the financial support of Mr. Charles R. Crane and Ambassador Bakhmetev."
Note: This "Russian People's University in Chicago" lasted only a short time. D. S.
